subject: Investing
title: Free Cash Flow: The Real Dividend Source
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Free Cash Flow: The Real Dividend Source.

hook.text: A company reported strong earnings but couldn't cover its dividend. The secret was hidden in cash flow.

buildup.text: Free cash flow is operating cash flow minus capital expendituresâ€”the actual cash left after running the business.

discovery.text: Earnings can be manipulated with accounting tricks. Free cash flow is much harder to fake.

twist.text: A company can report profits while burning cash. Only FCF tells you if the dividend is truly funded.

climax.text: Divide dividends paid by free cash flow. A ratio under 70% usually means the dividend is well-covered.

punchline.text: Earnings are an opinion. Cash flow is a fact. Fund dividends with facts.

quiz.question: Why is free cash flow more reliable than earnings for assessing dividends?
options: It's harder to manipulate and shows actual cash available
